results.title: Travellin' round
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Richard Mason, Tourism Australia and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A girl and a boy in a Landrover, a motorcyclist and a continent. These are the most essential ingredients of a travel film with a difference, showing the beauties and splendours of Australia. Featuring Tom Burstall, Adam Plate, Ingrid Tantu, Lloyd Sutton, Susan Hannaford. Music and lyrics by Michael Carlos and Judy Henderson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Hannant, Richard Mason, Tourism Australia and Film Australia

results.title: Your body during adolescence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Health and Safety for You”.
Eighteen young people from thirteen to fifteen are shown to vary widely in size and shape, although all are changing from childhood to adulthood. The film mentions the general functions of the endocrine glands and the influence of the pituitary glands on growth changes, which may normally occur in any order. The structure and functioning of the male and female reproductive organs are outlined.

results.title: Way to a New World
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams, Richard Mason, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The old and the new in Papua New Guinea. The traditional way of life in the villages; trade with other villages, the belief in magic, raising garden crops, management of village affairs by the old men in secret, feasts and sing-sings, the initiation of the young men. The new ways; opportunities for education, improved health and child welfare, the introduction of cash crops and native cooperation associations, the formation of elected Local Government Councils.

results.title: The Valley is ours
results.creator_credit: Stanley Hawes, John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This classic documentary celebrates the variety of activities the Murray River and the surrounding district sustains: from agriculture to timber, fishing to mining, fruit picking to shipbuilding. There is a special focus on the optimistic spirit of the people of the region as they overcome problems of erosion, bushfire and drought and makes a plea for further development, arguing that at least another million people could find happy homes in this fertile territory.

results.title: The Twentieth
results.brief_description: A record of the Twentieth Jazz Convention held in Sydney from December 26th to 31st, 1966. The main site of the convention was the Railways Institute but some bayside hotels, including the Coogee Bay Hotel, also became part of the scene. Includes some interesting shots of old inner Sydney streetscapes as well as the Opera House under construction. The first Jazz Convention was held in 1946 in Melbourne and features traditional jazz and blues music - 79 bands registered for this 20th convention. Performers included Graeme Bell, Nick Politis, Eric Richards, and the Original Australian Washboard Wackers. A must for lovers of jazz. Photography: Tom Cowan, Nigel Buesst.

results.title: Toronto jazz
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Toronto is regarded as the third largest jazz centre in North America. This film features a cross-section of jazz bands of that city: the Lenny Breau Trio, the Don Thompson Quintet and the Alf Jones Quartet. Their styles show creative self-expression, hard work, and improvisation.

results.title: Three To Go: Toula
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Part of a trilogy concerning the problems of young people in Australia. Toula is a girl in a Greek migrant family living in a Greek community in Sydney. She wants desperately to be a young, modern Australian, but she loves her parents and they demand a different way of life. In spite of family difference, gradually Toula and her brother establish a blend of Greek and Australian, bi-lingual and bi-social, which provides a certain amount of satisfaction for all concerned.

results.title: Smokes and Lollies
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Penny Chapman, South Australian Film Corporation and 1:1 Films
results.brief_description: First film in a longitudinal study of three Adelaide girls, aged thirteen and fourteen. They talk about their attitudes to sex and boys, pregnancy, abortion, marriage, school, parenthood and their careers. Their hopes and ambitions pose special questions for adults and young people alike. Edited by David Pulbrook; sound by Rod Pascoe and photographed by Tom Cowan.

results.title: Shine, Sir!
results.creator_credit: Kiwi Polish Company and The London Press Exchange
results.brief_description: An early advertising film, using animation, which promotes Australian made Kiwi boot and shoe polish and a fair capitalist system that allows for the initiative of youngsters. The ‘Imperial Hotel’ is left short staffed during World War I. Two young boys apply for the position of boot boys, but lament that they can’t clean boots. An Australian soldier, overhearing their conversation, offers each of them a tin of Kiwi boot polish which has impressive results and secures employment for them at the hotel.

results.title: Saturday
results.creator_credit: Dean Semler, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Describes a day in the lives of Coral and John Whelan and family, who live at Lake Cargelligo, a small country town in outback New South Wales.
